monster.name: White Greatwyrm

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The greatwyrm can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Draconic Might
entries: The greatwyrm's weapon attacks are magical and deal quadruple damage to objects and structures. When it hits a target with a melee attack, if the attack roll meets or exceeds the target's passive Strength ({@skill Athletics}) score, the greatwyrm can push it up to 10 feet away, or 20 feet away if its mythic trait is active.

trait.name: Absolute Zero (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, it instead resets to maximum hit points, and it can end any spells of its choice on itself. It then unleashes a blast of elemental cold in a 120 foot radius. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of the dragon's next turn.

trait.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Whenever the greatwyrm makes a saving throw, it can roll a {@dice d10} and add the result to the total.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The greatwyrm can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the greatwyrm's choice that is within 1 mile of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the greatwyrm's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The greatwyrm exhales an icy blast in a 300-foot cone. Each creature and object in that area takes 88 ({@damage 16d10}) cold damage ({@dc 25} Constitution save for half). Damaged surfaces in this area then become {@hazard slippery ice} (DMG 110) until cleared.

reaction.name: Vicious Reprisal
entries: In response to taking damage, the greatwyrm makes a bite attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the greatwyrm can attack an object, or it can move up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes two tail attacks, one of which must be against an object.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm makes a claw attack against each creature and object within 10 feet of it.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's mythic trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Fling
entries: One Huge or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the greatwyrm is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

mythic.name: Icicle Impale
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h} 19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

mythic.name: Ice Shards (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm causes shards of ice to burst forth from any ice within 120 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of that ice takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage ({@dc 25} Dexterity save for half). If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Snowstorm (1/Day)
entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical snowstorm in a 1 mile radius that lasts for 1 hour. Use the {@hazard blizzard|IDRotF} (IDRotF 10) or {@hazard heavy precipitation} (DMG 110) entry to represent its effects. The greatwyrm ignores all effects caused by the snowstorm.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Change Shape.
entries: You can decide that a dragon acquires this action at a younger age than usual, particularly if you want to feature a dragon in Humanoid form in your campaign:

The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

items.name: Flyby,
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry.
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation.
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses.
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.

mythic.name: Corrosive Decay (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a burst of rot and acid in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within 90 feet of it. Each creature and object in the area takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage ({@dc 25} Dexterity save for half). Objects in the area become permanently vulnerable to all damage, and each creature that takes this damage suffers disadvantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn.

mythic.name: Summon Shambling Mound (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm magically creates a {@creature shambling mound} in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it. The shambling mound takes its turn on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties) each round and carries out the greatwyrm's malefic will to the best of its ability.

bonus.name: Rampage
entries: When the greatwyrm reduces a creature or a Gargantuan object to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can use this bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

bonus.name: Gas Cloud (1/Day)
entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a cloud of toxic gas in a 1 mile radius that lasts for 1 hour. The gas reduces visibility to 120 feet, and everything within that radius is lightly obscured. While in this gas, living creatures are plagued by constant coughing and cannot benefit from resistance to acid or poison. If a living creature dies while in the gas, insects and filth possess its corpse, causing it to rise as a {@creature zombie} in the same space. The greatwyrm ignores all effects caused by the cloud.

entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 16} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h} 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) lightning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage. On a critical hit, the target must also succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of the dragon's next turn.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's mythic trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Fling
entries: One Huge or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the greatwyrm is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

mythic.name: Vortex
entries: The greatwyrm uses its horn to channel elemental wind, sucking in any number of Huge or smaller creatures or objects within 90 feet of it using a powerful vortex. Each target is pulled up to 40 feet towards the greatwyrm ({@dc 24} Strength save for half).

mythic.name: Lightning Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm causes a bolt of lightning to strike a point on the ground within 120 feet of it. Each creature and object within 5 feet of that point takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) lightning damage ({@dc 24} Dexterity save for half). If the save fails by 5 or more, a creature is also {@condition deafened} until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn.

bonus.name: Superstorm (1/Day)
entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a violent storm in a 1 mile radius that lasts for 1 hour. The storm is either a rainstorm or a sandstorm, depending on the features of the surrounding environment. {@hazard Strong wind} (DMG 110) batters the area and causes any creature in it that is knocked {@condition prone} to also be flung up to 30 feet in a random direction.

Every 5 rounds, an {@creature air elemental} spawns at a random location in the storm, taking its turn on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties) of each round and carrying out the greatwyrm's malefic will to the best of its ability. The greatwyrm and the elementals ignore all effects caused by the storm.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Change Shape.
entries: You can decide that a dragon acquires this action at a younger age than usual, particularly if you want to feature a dragon in Humanoid form in your campaign:

The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

items.name: Flyby,
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry.
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation.
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses.
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.

monster.name: Red Greatwyrm

trait.name: Draconic Might
entries: The greatwyrm's weapon attacks are magical and deal quadruple damage to objects and structures. When it hits a target with a melee attack, if the attack roll meets or exceeds the target's passive Strength ({@skill Athletics}) score, the greatwyrm can push it up to 10 feet away, or 20 feet away if its mythic trait is active.

trait.name: Shrug it Off
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the greatwyrm can end one condition on itself, provided it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Fiery Rebirth (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm dies, its body burns away into a pile of ashes. Its body then reforms from these ashes at the start of its next turn, resetting to maximum hit points, ending any spells of its choice on itself, and becoming active again. When this happens, each creature that can see the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn.

trait.name: Spreading Magma
entries: Some of the greatwyrm's features might cause magma to burst forth from a surface, making it molten for a time. While molten, the surface is difficult terrain, and any creature that ends its turn while touching it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the greatwyrm's choice that is within 1 mile of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the greatwyrm's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Inferno Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The greatwyrm exhales fire in a 300-foot cone. Each creature and object in that area takes 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage ({@dc 26} Dexterity save for half). Damaged surfaces in the area become molten until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes two tail attacks, one of which must be against an object.

legendary.name: Flame Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 18} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h} 17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) fire damage. On a critical hit, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against fire damage until the end of the dragon's next turn. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's mythic trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Chosen of Tiamat
entries: Channeling the power of the mother of dragons herself, the greatwyrm grants itself advantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.

mythic.name: Fling
entries: One Huge or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the greatwyrm is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

mythic.name: Volcanic Eruption (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm causes lava to erupt from every molten surface within 120 feet of it. Each creature and object within 10 feet of a molten surface when this happens takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage ({@dc 26} Dexterity save for half). If the save fails by 5 or more, a creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Rain of Fire (1/Day)
entries: The greatwyrm causes fiery meteors to rain down on an area in a 1 mile radius that lasts for 1 hour. Small meteor impacts cause every creature and object exposed to the sky to take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of the greatwyrm's turns.
Additionally, when a creature or object drops to 0 hit points while in the storm, magma explodes out from it, causing the area within 10 feet of it to become molten until cleared.

monster.name: Tiamat

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Tiamat fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Tiamat drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Nine Hells, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Divine Will
entries: Tiamat is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form, as well as those that would read her thoughts, determine if she is lying, or magically influence her thoughts or behavior.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Tiamat can take one reaction per turn, rather than only one per round. She also has advantage on saving throws against being knocked {@condition unconscious}. If she fails a saving throw against an effect that would stun a creature, one of her unspent legendary actions is spent.

trait.name: Draconic Might
entries: Tiamat's weapon attacks are magical and deal quadruple damage to objects and structures. When she hits a target with a melee attack, if the attack roll meets or exceeds the target's passive Strength ({@skill Athletics}) score, Tiamat can push it up to 10 feet away, 20 feet away if one of her mythic traits are active, or 30 feet away if both mythic traits are active.

trait.name: Dragon Queen's Roar (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: If Tiamat would be reduced to 0 hit points, she instead resets to maximum hit points, and she can end any spells of her choice on herself. She then releases a huge roar that decimates the area within 300 feet of her, causing each creature and object of her choice in the area, regardless of size or structural stability, to be pushed up to 60 feet away from Tiamat and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Infernal Dealings (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: If Tiamat would be reduced to 0 hit points, she instead resets to maximum hit points, and she can end any spells of her choice on herself. She then regurgitates ten {@creature Merregon|mtf|merregons} who land in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of her. The merregons act at the end of the initiative order and defend Tiamat to the best of their ability.

trait.name: Sense Avarice
entries: If a creature Tiamat can see communicates telepathically with her, she learns the creature's greatest desires.

action.name: Catastrophic Breath
entries: Tiamat exhales elemental energy from one of her heads in a 300-foot cone. Each creature and object in that area takes 97 ({@damage 15d12}) damage ({@dc 27} saving throw for half; see below), with the damage type, save type, and secondary effect determined by which head she used.
Once Tiamat chooses a breath weapon  for one of her heads, she can't choose another one associated with that head on her next turn.

items.name: White: Frost Breath.
items.entry: The breath does cold damage, and its save type is Constitution. Damaged surfaces in this area then become {@hazard slippery ice} (DMG 110) until cleared.

items.name: Black: Corrosive Breath.
items.entry: The breath does acid damage, and the save type is Dexterity. Damaged surfaces in this area then become corrosive acid pools until cleared. Any creature or object that touches one of these surfaces takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) acid damage; a target can't take this damage more than once per round.

items.name: Green: Noxious Breath.
items.entry: The breath does poison damage, and the save type is Constitution. Damaged surfaces in this area then grow thick vines that grasp at nearby creatures until cleared. Any Large or smaller creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of these vines is {@condition grappled} by them (escape {@dc 15}).

items.name: Blue: Storm Breath.
items.entry: The breath does lightning damage, and the save type is Dexterity. If a Huge or smaller target fails this save by 5 or more, it is also pushed up to 30 feet away from the greatwyrm.

items.name: Red: Inferno Breath.
items.entry: The breath does fire damage, and the save type is Dexterity. Damaged surfaces in this area then become molten until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. While molten, the surface is difficult terrain, and any creature that ends its turn while touching it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Nimble Predator
entries: Tiamat moves up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 19 ({@damage 3d12}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (Tiamat's choice).

legendary.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}), {@condition restrained}, and has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws until this grapple ends. The aspect can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Tiamat casts one of her innate spells.

mythicHeader: If one of Tiamat's mythic traits were activated in the last hour, she can use the first three options below as legendary actions. If both traits were activated in the last hour, she can instead use any of the options below.

entries: The evil queen of dragons is a fearsome god of greed, envy, and hoarded wealth. While chromatic dragons are her foremost worshipers, Tiamat accepts the worship of any who crave wealth. All chromatic dragons have a fearful reverence for their tyrannical queen, but many dragons of near-deific power and ambition chafe under her rule.
Tiamat remains imprisoned in Avernus, the first of the Nine Hells, influencing the souls of chromatic dragons across the planes and seeking the means to free herself.
The stat block presented represents Tiamat in her full form. To represent her aspect, remove one of her mythic traits.
Only by meeting specific conditions can the characters hope to bypass her Discorporation trait and truly kill Tiamat. The following are sample quests.

entries.name: Appeal to Avarice
entries: An ancient treasure was lost in the Astral Sea while being transported in a githyanki ship. If the party can locate this cache of immaculate gems and rare metals, they can use Tiamat's greed to draw her out of her domain. They must trick her into entering a domain under the control of Bahamut, where she can be slain, or at least her discorporated essence can be trapped.

entries.name: Draconic Weapons
entries: The party must kill five greatwyrms, each of a different chromatic variety, then craft magic items from their bones or scales. Only if they are wearing or using these items can they destroy Tiamat. At least one of the greatwyrms killed for this purpose must be a past or present consort of Tiamat.

entries.name: Gather Tiamat's Eggs
entries: One hoary old tome printed on basalt pages and bound in purple dragon scales describes a ritual called Fashioning Tiamat's True Death. This ritual's intricate recipe includes procuring at least one of Tiamat's eggs, in which a newly forged weapon must be quenched. Multiple weapons require multiple eggs. If the weapon is used against Tiamat and draws blood at least once, the god's essence is destroyed, not discorporated.

entries.name: Targeting Objects
entries: When a feature here says that it targets an object, it really means an object that isn't being worn or carried. I just couldn't be bothered to write that every single time.

legendaryHeader: Tiamat can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Tiamat regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tiamat's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}). She can innately cast the following spells:

bonus.name: Apocalypse (1/Day)
entries: TIamat unleashes an apocalyptic storm in a 1 mile radius that lasts for 1 hour. The area is battered by {@hazard heavy precipitation} and {@hazard strong wind}, and violent elemental energies cause every creature and object exposed to the storm to take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (Tiamat's choice) at the start of each of Tiamat's turns. Tiamat, and any elemental effect she creates, is unaffected by the storm.

bonus.name: Corrupting Presence
entries: Each creature of Tiamat's choice that is within 1 mile of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} (Tiamat's choice) for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Tiamat's Corrupting Presence for the next 24 hours.

mythic.name: Divine Greed
entries: Tiamat steals the magic benefiting one creature she can see within 90 feet of her. Any beneficial spell affecting the target of her choice is transferred to Tiamat. If a spell she steals requires concentration, Tiamat concentrates on it for the duration instead, but she cannot concentrate on multiple spells simultaneously (as normal).

mythic.name: Tail Sweep
entries: Tiamat makes a tail attack against each creature and object within 30 feet of her.

mythic.name: Chilling Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Tiamat uses her green and white heads to assault each creature of her choice that she can see within a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the area takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage ({@dc 25} Intelligence save for half). On a failed save, a target is also {@condition poisoned} and has its speed halved until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn.

mythic.name: Toxic Gas (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Tiamat uses her black and green heads to unleash toxic gas in a 60-foot radius around her. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of Tiamat's next turn. A creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

mythic.name: Fiery Tornado (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Tiamat uses her blue and red heads to unleash a cyclone in a 30-foot radius centered on a point she can see. Each creature and object in the vortex takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage ({@dc 25} Dexterity save for half). On a failed save, a Huge or smaller creature is also hurled 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}.

mythic.name: Hurl Through Hell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Tiamat targets a creature she is grappling. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage and be banished to Avernus (the first layer of the Nine Hells). At the start of Tiamat's next turn, the creature reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of her.

monsterFluff.name: Chromatic Greatwyrms
entries: By absorbing the energies of a powerful primordial object or creature, chromatic dragons can ascend into greatwyrms. Chromatic greatwyrms wield unfathomable elemental magic that places them just short of a deity's aspect in destructive might.

As it comes with immortality and almost completely unrivaled power, greatwyrm status is vied for by all chromatic dragons with the means to achieve it. An adult or ancient dragon might spend an entire campaign gathering the artifacts and creatures needed to complete the ascension ritual.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food, drink, or air.

entries.name: Targeting Objects
entries: When a feature here says that it targets an object, it really means an object that isn't being worn or carried. I just couldn't be bothered to write that every single time.
